Cinnamon Rolls

Soft and fluffy cinnamon rolls with a rich pecan and raisin filling, topped with a sweet vanilla glaze. Perfect for a festive morning treat.

Yield: 12 rolls

Source: https://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/valerie-bertinelli/christmas-morning-cinnamon-rolls-3539006

baking

Ingredients

Dough

  • 1 cup warm whole milk
  • 1/3 cup granulated sugar
  • 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
  • 1 teaspoon kosher salt
  • One 1/4-ounce package active dry yeast
  • 2 large eggs
  • 4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
  • Vegetable oil, for the bowl

Filling

  • 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened, plus more for the baking dish
  • 3/4 cup light brown sugar
  • 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon
  • 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg

Procedure

Prepare the Dough

  1. Combine the milk, granulated sugar, butter, salt, and yeast in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the hook attachment; stir to combine.
  2. Add the eggs and stir until well mixed.
  3. Add the flour and mix on medium-high speed until the dough is smooth and elastic, about 4 minutes.
  4. Transfer the dough to a lightly oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap or a clean kitchen towel, and let stand in a warm, draft-free place until doubled in size, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

Prepare the Filling

  1. Butter a 13-by-9-inch glass baking dish.
  2. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough into an 18-by-12-inch rectangle.
  3. Spread the softened butter evenly over the dough, leaving a 1/2-inch border.
  4. Sprinkle the brown sugar and cinnamon evenly over the buttered dough.
  5. Add pecans and raisins if using.

Shape and Rise the Rolls

  1. Starting with a short end, roll up the dough tightly and press the edges to seal.
  2. Cut the dough into 12 slices and arrange them in the buttered baking dish.
  3. Cover with plastic wrap and let stand until doubled in size, about 1 hour, or refrigerate overnight.
  4. If refrigerated, let the rolls sit at room temperature for 1 hour before baking.

Bake the Rolls

  1. Preheat the oven to 375Â°F.
  2. Bake the cinnamon rolls until puffed and golden brown, about 25 minutes.

Prepare the Frosting

  1. See Cream Cheese Frosting recipe
